chapter.title: Uses of XML
chapter.para: You can use it to separate your data from your HTML.
It is easily upgradeable, because it is always in plain text.

chapter.title: XML is verbose!
chapter.para: While some may consider XML to be very verbose (which it can be), it makes up for it with a lot of other useful features. Mainly it is more readable, and it is also highly interoperable. Due to these facts one can often look past XML being very verbose.

Another reason, you can look past the verbosity of XML, is that it can normally be compressed. When it is compressed the file size is almost a non-issue. Plus with computers getting faster and faster these days, with more and more memory, it becomes a whole lot easier to store files that are a little bit bigger, if they are more readable. Plus, more readable code is more maintainable, so having verbose XML is probably a good thing.
